tension.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax
tension.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The tension was becoming unbearable, and I wanted to scream.
Exercise is the ideal way to relieve tension after a hard day.
tension.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the feeling that exists when people or countries do not trust each other and may suddenly attack each other or start arguing
tension.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: In those days, there was a great deal of racial tension on campus.
The obvious tension between Warren and Anne made everyone else uncomfortable.
tension.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if there is tension between two things, there is a difference between the needs or influences of each, and that causes problems
tension.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: In business, there’s always a tension between the needs of customers and shareholders.
tension.translation[0].definitions[3].de: tightness or stiffness in a wire, rope, muscle etc
tension.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Tension in the neck muscles can cause headaches.
Muscle tension can be a sign of stress.
tension.translation[0].definitions[4].de: the amount of force that stretches something
tension.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: This wire will take 50 pounds tension.
There was a lot of tension on the wire before it snapped.
